Reviews.Title: “Good overnight hotel”
Reviews.Author: Englishlee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before catching an early flight from Schoenefeld airport. The airport shuttle collected us from the railway station, it runs every half hour and collects both from the station and the airport itself. It's about 1km from the station to the station so only a short drive and in fact it would be walkable on a nice day. The welcome from the front desk staff was very good and we got upgraded to a junior suite which was very pleasant. It looks as if the hotel has recently been refurbished and they seem to have done a good job. Had dinner in the restaurant, I generally avoid hotel restaurants but in this one the food was actually pretty good, but the service was patchy. Order taken promptly, food was delivered quick enough and was hot and tasty. But then nothing, no-one came near us to ask if we wanted another drink, did we want dessert or to bring the bill, in the end I had to get up and ask for it, and I noticed others doing the same. Don't get me wrong the service was friendly enough, but I'm used to people coming to me not the other way around. But it was the accommodation we were actually there for and that was fine. Caught the free shuttle bus to the airport the next morning which worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mihalides
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was OK. Despite the fact that we had asked for S-bahn station we weren’t told about free shuttle service to and from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE SHUTTLE SERVICE IS TERRIBLE! MONEY FOR EVERYTHING and NO POOL!!”
Reviews.Author: tolgaakr
Reviews.Content: the only reason I selected this hotel was for its shuttle service and I had to wait for 25 min. at the cold of the night for a shuttle to come from 1km away because non of the super brilliant receptionists told me that it runs on a schedule. not even the one I called to ask for sending the shuttle when I arrive to pick-up point. it is also very frustrating that they even charge for the usage of the computer at the reception. I would say it is totally not worth the money to stay here. pay 5 euro to taxi and get another airport hotel even if they don't have shuttle. THEY ALSO ADVERTISE ON BOOKING.COM THAT THEY HAVE A POOL BUT THEY DONT!!! I PAID EXTRA 10 EURO TO ACCESS THE SPA WHICH WAS REALLY MONEY THROWN AWAY

Reviews.Title: “Normal Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: magw78
Reviews.Content: It is very good aiprort hotel. When you have early flight form Berlin (Schoenefeld) Airport it is good choice. Good and clean rooms, very helpfull stuff. Shuttle service work perfect. We didn't test the breakfast buffet because of early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Long way from Berlin”
Reviews.Author: bigmanfoody
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this property for 4 days in October. It was a complete SNAFU on my part as I originaly thought this was close to the international airport. I should have guessed by the price (had the Lindburgh suite...very nice), 100 Euros/night. The room was as large and accomadating as anything in North America, whis is unusual in Europe. Everything was clean and fresh. Was unfortuante enough to lose my luggage due to an unexpected teansfer in Philly!! Staff were very sympathetic and helpful. Restaurant was good (had a great breakfast buffet) and parking was free.

Reviews.Title: “"Hotel chain charges for internet?''”
Reviews.Author: mcrmmay
Reviews.Content: Room is very good, shuttle service works perfectly. Restaurant is OK. It is as good hotel for an early flight from Schoenefeld.But, it is unbelievable for me how come a chain this big charge guests for internet EVEN I N THE LOBBY!! Charging for wi fi is like charging for electricity or water in the shower!!! There are neighbourhoods, parks, schools that offer wifi around the world...Why do a guest have to pay 10 euros for internet connection in a place like this?????? Wouldn't stay here again for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: stefanier918
Reviews.Content: We stayed here kinda last minute for New Years, so needless to say there wasn't much to choose from in the city. A group of 7 with no children. We relied on the shuttle that runs every 30 minutes to the airport and it worked very well for us. By train it took about 45 minutes to get to downtown Berlin. Rooms are soundproof-never hear a plane land or take off. We were very pleased with our suite! We had a corner room with lots of windows, tons of storage, standard bathroom, wired internet (which I think costs), and room service was available. The hotel in general is started to show signs of age, so hopefully renovations are in future plans. Standard hotel breakfast was 19 Euro!!! Pricey, but the only option around unless you plan on driving somewhere. This would be the perfect place to stay if you're flying, and know this isn't two train stops from the Brandenburg Gate! We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blumit
Reviews.Content: This is our second time in the same hotel. We love the comfort of the beds, very good breakfast and the fact that we are welcome there with our cats.

Reviews.Title: “International Airport: Yes.. but WHICH airport?”
Reviews.Author: HazemHussein
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as I needed to stay by the airport overnight.. However it turned out to be in Berlin Schonefeld airport and not the main airport: Tegel.. Beware of falling in the same trap as the name of the hotel is deceiving, unless you are willing to pay a hefty price for a 30km taxi ride, the connection between the 2 airports is very time consuming and requires transfers betrween buses/trains.. The hotel itself is pleasant with contemporary decor and the open buffet dinner is recommended, however smoking rooms on first floor are all twins, The elevator of this hotel is in urgent need to be replaced as it makes funny noises!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy but beware”
Reviews.Author: LaStef42
Reviews.Content: Very good rooms, good food, good conference location but service is bad. Internet access is very expensive EUR 10 a day but EUR 25 a week. I got a room with cable connection and had to deposit EUR 10 for the cable which they refused to pay back (didn't find it in their computer that I had the cable although I had it in my hand). Don't rely on their shuttle from the train station as it doesn't always come and often not on time. Couldn't get an invoice for my stay as there was something wrong with their computer. Asked for it to be sent but it hasn't arrived. Have complained maybe I will get the invoice someday and the deposit for the cable but be very careful with getting everything written and have good time when you check out as you can run into complications. I was not the only one complaining not to get the deposit for the cable back when I had to leave for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for one night near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Jeanleguen
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is situated very closed to the Schoenefeld airport and has a shuttle to take you from/tp it at any time of the day. The great points are the "Holiday Inn" standards, including the very good breakfast. The bad point is that if you want to do something more than sleep and go to the airport - just avoid, there is nothing to do around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect transit location on to Schoenefeld Airport”
Reviews.Author: Burek_Polny
Reviews.Content: We were happy to book with HI Schoenefeld again, as this was not our first stay there. PROS: Easily accessible from motorway, very close to airport, swift check in, our family reservation was immediately upgraded to executive suite, we found the rooms clean, spacious and quiet (even though airport close by), beds very comfortable, hotel is safe for children. An ease to travellers is a free shuttle bus to airport leaving hotel two times an hour. CONS: Breakfast quality. :/ We are sensitive and touchy on this one, there's nothing worse than leaving the hotel hungry. Breakfasts offered a variety of choices, unfortunately most of them came cold, just as our coffee. We also had to wait over 20 min to get our omlettes and fried eggs at kitchen counter prepared, even though we were the only ones to order! The cook was simply unbelievably slow. Apart from this, the WIFI connection was pretty poor, too. And not free, even in lobby. We would however recommend this hotel to anyone travelling by air from Schoenefeld or the new Berlin Brandenburg airport to be completed next year. We will definitely rebook, trusting the management to improve breakfast quality. ;)

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing one-night stand”
Reviews.Author: cuppy51
Reviews.Content: Stopped over one night on our way to Greece. We are priority members , however the staff went way beyond the expected. We have stayed here before and thought it was wonderful but this time took the cake! We were greeted on arrival with a complimentary drink from the bar, then given two bowels of fresh fruit and bottled water in our room as well as an all round train ticket good for two days which we used to go into the city of Berlin to our favorite German restaurant. The room was spacious and comfy and we totally loved the robes. We will definitely stay here again and again and again....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: TartanFeet
Reviews.Content: We had 22 hours in Berlin and stayed here overnight. Fantastic free shuttle bus between the Airport, Hotel and Train Station every 15 mins until 11pm Dumped our bags and headed into Berlin (25 mins or so) direct to Frederickstrasse (spelling?) and went to see the sights Checkpoint Charlie, Berlin Wall, Brandenburg Gate had dinner and train back. Fantastic Room was clean, big enough for 2 adults and 2 kids and we had a fantastic breakfast in the morning

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back only if necessary”
Reviews.Author: Villemo_Lind
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very nice design and is quite clean (however not enough for allergics). Stuff working at the reception desk was really kind and helpful. The hotel bus service runned 24h/day and was on time when I had to go to the airport at 4 am. Unfortunatelly, the distance to the city centre was very long so I couldn't visit it in the afternoon. But I booked that hotel only because of the flight from Schoenefeld so I didn't mind it. There were two things that put me off: 1) Internet connection isn't for free 2) Food at the hotel restaurant was moulded!!! When I reported it to the waiter who finally appeared, he started behaving very rude. He kept trying convincing me that there is no mould on the cake and said with anger "If you don't want to pay for the cake you don't have to!!!" He stopped when I informed him that I'm a microbiology student so I can distinguish mould from bakery. When he was leaving the hall he spluttered very loudly. No one apologized me. I expected a better service at Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not the best”
Reviews.Author: catie2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as we were flying out of Berlin early on Sunday after a train tour around Germany. It was much further out than I expected, so we spent a good deal of time backwards and forwards on the train. You are reliant on the shuttle bus, which worked well most of the time, but when we got back on Saturday we waited 40 minutes, and we had to leave 6 people waiting as the minibus was full. I found the reception staff very snooty and not welcoming, and it is a hotel which will rip you off for everything, water, wi-fi and breakfast (19 Euros each). There is no where else nearby so you pays your money or wait an hour to get into the centre. Rooms were good quality, but there is a design fault - a window in the bathroom which means a spotlight shines in your eyes if your partner goes to the bathroom in the night!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sandrastica
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in this hotel, worst idea ever! We chose it mainly because it was near the airport and we arrived there on a Friday night and they had a free shuttle bus service between the airport, the train station and the hotel. The first night everything was as expected but on Saturday, we asked at the reception desk if there would be shuttle service until late night (they told us it was a 24h service) and the bus worked every 20 minutes, great! That night, at 22.00h we were at the station, and, after 30 minutes waiting we had to call to the hotel and ask to be picked up, they told us then than that night there was no bus service (they could have told us that morning!). They advice to hire a taxi and they told us they would pay the fare, as it was their fault. We were happy enough with the answer but, every single taxi we asked, wouldn't take us to the hotel, as they said that was "too little money" (the hotel is only about 2kms from the airport/train station). We called the hotel again to ask for help, as they had seem quite aware that the whole problem was their fault but this time they were not that helpful! We were told that the taxi drivers did not take us seriously because we couldn't speak German (?!¿) and that, according to the German law, a taxi driver cannot refuse passengers on these grounds... Thus, we were stuck at the airport, is was really late at night, we had walked all day but... hopefully we had our GPS with us and we managed to find our way to the hotel walking. But it is not that near when you have already walked the city all day, you have to walk the deserted dark streets of the area and you feel you've been treated like crap! We finally arrived at the hotel at 00:20, which ruined our night and also the next morning. We were quite angry and wanted to file a written complain but they wouldn't let us write any! They told us the manager would speak to us the next morning and that he started working at 10.00 AM. We waited till then, losing our precious time, as we still had a lot to see in Berlin, but, what a surprise, the manager wasn't coming to work until 11.00 (or at least, that was what we were told). Then we just decided we would file the complain and leave, but, as much as we tried, the assistant manager (who obviously, was not informed of our problem by the night staff) didn't let us do so either! We couldn't even write a proper complaint! We think the whole staff were really unprofessional for a 4-star hotel. And, by the way, we were told we would be contacted on the next day by the manager… as you can imagine, we're still waiting for his call! Just don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for early flight only”
Reviews.Author: kellyabra
Reviews.Content: If you have an early flight out of Berlin (we had one at 7am) then this hotel is the way to go., It is very clean, the rooms are spacious and modern and they offer a free shuttle service every 20 minutes. However, there is absolutely NOTHING around the hotel. So make sure you eat early because the only choices that you will have is the hotel restaurant or the gummy bears left on the pillow.

Reviews.Title: “OK but wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: mhr035
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 1 night before an early morning flight at this Holiday Inn near the airport. On arrival, after waiting nearly 20mins for the shuttle service, we were told they've run out of key cards and someone from reception will have to open the door each time we want to enter our room. At first try, the "master key card" didn't work and the guy ran back to reception - he was quite friendly and apologetic. We arrived quite late - around 22:40 and specifically asked if there were food available. We were told that the bar serves food till 2pm. Once we got to the room and settled we discovered that after 11pm the bar only serves 3 "snacks" - soup, meatballs and something else - so not much choice and if you don't fancy the above - nothing. The room is nice, spacious and clean and the bed is firm which I like. Can't wrong the room. Be warned the bottle of mineral water in the room is priced EUR5. Coffee and tea making facilities are available as well as a mini bar. On Sunday morning we arrived at reception for check out before 9am. Check-out was a nightmare. Groups of cyclists and police were staying at the hotel and some had lots of issues with their bills. There were only 2 people manning reception and we queued for almost 30-40 minutes which resulted in us almost missing our flight. Due to not having any luggage to check in, 40 minute allowance to check out, reach the airport and go through security was deemed adequate - it was not! We would not stay here again unless we are really, really desperate for a room - as the overall experience was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “My Future Home For Six Months (On and Off)”
Reviews.Author: BrianDiana
Reviews.Content: Life brings change and one of the major changes for me is the requirement to visit Berlin on a regular basis for the next six months or so. The Holiday Inn Berlin International is the nearest hotel that meets my requirements. Firstly, I must emphasise this review is purely from business viewpoint. The only reason one would stay at this Holiday Inn is because of business or a quick stop over whilst passing through SFX. The hotel is modern, well placed for the airport and Mahlowe business district with a regular shuttle to SFX. The rooms have comfortable beds, a work area/desk with internet connection and bath/showers with lower-end toiletries bolted to the wall. There is a bar and restaurant with expensive drink and food when compared to local facilities (not walkable) and whilst the food is good, it's going to be boring after two or three nights. There are comprehensive conference facilities. There is no noise from the airport. The staff is friendly, helpful and efficient. It's a place to pass through with neither drama or memories.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: wanderglory
Reviews.Content: The only reason one would stay at this hotel is because they have a conference at the hotel itself and plan to take a flight from the international airport close by. We were in Berlin for a holiday and made the mistake of staying here although we were going to spend most of our time in the city. Rooms were standard holiday inn fare. The hotel was still being completed and there was a lot of noise from all the construction. Staff was not terribly friendly. Although there are regular shuttles to and from the airport and train station, we ended up spending a lot of time and money getting to the city and back.

Reviews.Title: “An airport hotel - but not a credit to Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: kapitanniemand
Reviews.Content: We stayed there and asked a friend who was travelling to Berlin to join us as well and boom another room. We hadn't banked on how far it was by public transport to get to Berlin - our mistake though, so can't blame the hotel - which has a free shuttle which is very convenient. Would recommend it for a business trip if you have an early or late flight, not for tourists who want to sightsee. The area around and the backyard of the hotel itself had a significant amount of construction work happening which was no help to our asthmatic friend. The rooms were decent and the amenities a Holiday Inn standard. It ticked all the boxes, but nothing beyond. Not the best Holiday Inn I've stayed at, and not the best Airport Hotel - but no real issues either.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Business Stop-Over from Abroad”
Reviews.Author: concord0767
Reviews.Content: We have met with business people coming from abroad, as the hotel is a stone-throw away from the airport Schoenefeld. Pick-up/Shuttle service is granted, both from/to the airport and from the S-Bahn-Station Schoenefeld. This is working very well and at comfort ! For meetings inside the hotel there is enough space, meeting rooms and even at the lobby you have space at convenience. If you need short access to your e-mails; there is a complimentary WLAN service with voucher. No need to say that the connection works very well. Internet in the room is with highspeed lan available. You make sure that you have your cable with you ... Food etc. excellent and breakfast at 10,-- Euro is acceptable price/quality level. Only, if you want to go downtown, you have to calculate 30 min by taxi and avearage price between 40-45 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and convenient for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: murrayandamanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in a Deluxe king room with separate sitting area having flown into Schoeneberg prior to an onward trip to Poland. Paid only E10 extra to upgrade to deluxe room. This room was considerably bigger than the norm and very bright as it had windows on two sides (situated at the corner of the building). Be warned, though, the sofa in the sitting area of the room is the sofa bed for any extra guests so once that's made up the floor space reduces a bit and then of course you lose your sofa. Room was extremely clean and beds were very comfortable with crisp linen. Not much in the way of English telly on the cable service but you could pay extra for sky. The most surprising thing about the stay was the really excellent evening meal we enjoyed in the restaurant. Normally we'd shy away from eating in chain hotels but this was reasonably priced and well cooked and there was a fair choice - although not much for vegetarians. Pleasant waiting staff. Good plentiful breakfast included in our room rate. We didn't use the gym/sauna. Hotel runs a free shuttle service to the airport station and the airport, but at busy times you may have to wait. We went out in good time for our return shuttle to the airport then others pushed in when the bus arrived and we had to wait for the next one - then only by being rather more forceful than is comfortable for English queuers did we muscle our way onto that one. Beware! Holiday Inn staff operating the shuttle service, in contrast to everyone else we met, were surly and disinterested. Express train into town from the airport station is frequent and cheap (E2.80) but takes about half an hour. I wouldn't recommend the hotel for a Berlin trip for that reason, and there is absolutely nothing round about it, but if you don't mind the travel, this is peaceful and comfortable, and I'd say better vfm than the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an overnight stay if you have an early flight to catch”
Reviews.Author: ktee1979
Reviews.Content: I was staying in the 'new'part of the hotel, it felt like I was the first person to use the room! It smelt so new. Very clean and modern. Free airport shuttle bus running every 20 mins from about 5:30am, earlier can be arranged through reception. Plasma TV and very comfortable bed with huge eurpoean pillows! I wasn't expecting much for an airport hotel but this was good.

Reviews.Title: “very good price”
Reviews.Author: globalvisits
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for me as I was arriving and departuring from Schonefeld airport. The price was surpricely low and the quality was great. I guess I got such good price because I booked good in advance. The hotel has clean and comfortable rooms. Connection between hotel and airport/city center is well organized. Reception an other personnel is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Charged Twice”
Reviews.Author: kelleykid
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. One big problem; I booked on a travel website and when I got there I was asked for my credit card...not an unusual request by any means. The guy at the front desk handed me a receipt for the entire amount of the room. I told him the room had already been paid for but he refused to budge. I looked at his original screen and he didn't seem to understand he had to press a button for the website to get charged. I was tired and not in the mood for an argument so I figured I would fix it later. Got back to the states and as I suspected I had been charged twice, the online company were not particularly helpful, but that was because the hotel refused to pick up the phone. I eventually called myself, told they would get back to me, and then they refused to take my calls. I am still out more than $100 and would never go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for airport”
Reviews.Author: Numberoneguest
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night due to late arrival at airport. Reception staff very friendly and smooth check-in. Room was nicely decorated and received Platinum Priority drink and donut in room which was nice. Shuttle service was good. Not sure why but lighting in bathroom appears to be red and very low intensity - showering was a fairly dark experience! As mentioned by other reviewers, building work continues, hammering started near my room at 7am. If you want a lie-in then make sure you get a room away from the noise if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Does what you need it to do”
Reviews.Author: ThereGoesDeon
Reviews.Content: It's a completely generic Holiday Inn that's superbly close to Schönefeld airport -- which is what you want it to be. We stayed there on our last night in Berlin solely because we had to be at the airport really early and didn't want to make the mission from central Berlin. It's a Holiday Inn. There is absolutely nothing to do in the area around it, and you can only really eat at its expensive restaurant. But you don't go there because it's lovely: you go there because it's somewhere non-horrible to sleep close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Room was noisy and near building work”
Reviews.Author: DoctorAndy
Reviews.Content: My one and only complaint about this hotel is about the building work being condicted on site. As a hotel, all is fine, albeit things on the pricey side. Just think I need to talk about the building work that pulls the rating down. Firstly the entrance to my room was in an area under renovation. I do not feel this room should have been in use for that reason. When I looked out of the window, I could see scaffolding right outside. Worst of all,. work seemed to begin at 7am on a Saturday morning!! Lots of noise with all the drilling etc. Also workmen right outside my window with a view into the room. I stayed at this hotel for a quiet night's sleep, but do not feel this goal was achieved. So I say avoid for the time being!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for late arrival”
Reviews.Author: erichschlaikjer
Reviews.Content: I took the RyanAir flight from Stansted arriving 22:30 and thought it would be a good idea to just stay nearby. I had difficulty finding the free shuttle bus to the hotel, finally asked a taxi driver. You get the bus in a parking lot at the extreme right as you come out of the terminal building. They are every 20mins. They stop at the train station, too. The hotel is across a big road in a bit of an industrial wasteland (huge post office) and definitely too far to walk. The staff was friendly and said that the bar was open till 1am if I still wanted food. Instead I paid 2 euro for 30 min non-contiguous internet time (pick up a cable at desk) and drank the beers in the room fridge. The room was clean and nice. Total cost 64 euro. I checked out quite early with no problems (and no time for breakfast) as I wanted to catch an early train from the Hauptbahnhof. This was also easy. A good choice, though I stayed in town at the Melia on my departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: lulu1106
Reviews.Content: We landed at the airport chose this hotel and booked, we couldnt get a double bed but that was ok as the bedding was lovely. The staff couldnt do more for us and went out of their way to explain things to us and were very friendly also . We stayed 2 nights and didnt mind catching the shuttle and train to town it was part of the experience. we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Risnes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, clean bright rooms and friendly staff. A very good breakfast and the evening meal is just great. They have a free shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel it also goes to the trianstation. A very quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT HOTEL, A FANTASTIC BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: mojave
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were arriving late at Schoenefeld airport, and decided to stay there for the night. Good idea. Almost everything was perfect, but the breakfast topped it all. Small shortcoming: the fitness room is poorly equipped.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: PellegrinaIsrael
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at this hotel instead of in Berlin-Mitte because I had a morning flight the following day and did not want to get stuck in traffic. I had a confirmed and "guaranteed reservation"- or so I thought, and so it was stated on the confirmatory e-mail I received from their webservice. Imagine my surprise, therefore, upon arriving at 10:40 pm at the hotel (I had warned them in advance that I would be arriving at this hour) to be told: "We are sorry, but there was a mistake in our computer and we don't have any room for you." So, if you want to be shipped off to some dinky second-rate replacement hotel in the back of beyond, by all means do make a reservation to stay here. However, from what I have seen since, rush hour is all the other way in any case, and there is truly no reason on earth ever to pay 100 Euros for the dubious privilege of being sent on night-time adventures to really bad hotels when you could so easily stay in the center of Berlin and actually have a reliable service. The hotel apologized and fully admitted that the entire fault was theirs- but this doesn't change the fact that they are utterly unreliable and that you are likely to find yourself in an unpleasant situation at an ungodly hour.

Reviews.Title: “good value, motivated staff”
Reviews.Author: wicketo
Reviews.Content: This is the first HI that honoured my platinum status with priorityclub in any significant way. Upgrade to a very spacious exec bedroom, freshly renovated with nice couch and flat screen tv, plus a bottle of sparkling wine and some sweets. All of which on a VERY affordable rate. Definately a good airport hotel. Sauna and gym are small and nothing special but in good condition. Can't say anything about the food, as we didn't have any. Shuttle service to SXF was on time and convinient. So thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Morningsider
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights whilst holidaying in Berlin. The room was spacious with good TV channel options and perfect for an early morning flight. The hotel operates three shuttles an hour to the train station and the airport. This is very convenient and worked well after spending a day sightseeing in the city. The train ride to the city is about 25-30 minutes and is quite comfortable. For the price paid, this turned out to be fantastic value. It was just about perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The right choice before an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: mc582
Reviews.Content: This is the right choice ONLY if you have an early morning choice, otherwise there is no reasons to sleep there for visiting Berlin. The hotel is located in the middle of nowhere, but a free shuttle service connects the train station, the hotel and the airport every 20 minutes. My room was very clean and nicely furnished; the bathroom was quite large and brand new. There was silence during the night and the bed (mattress/duvet) was perfect. I did not have the opportunity to try breakfast, but I looked at the Room Service menu and the selection seems to be quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and comfortable with great beds!”
Reviews.Author: Lutzi1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after arriving on a late flight, and the experience was just so easy and convenient. To catch the free shuttle tot he hotel you just go to the bank of courtesy phones to the right of the main exit, and they will tell you when the next one is due (they are frequent). Then go out of the main exit, turn right and walk a few yards to the shuttle bus stop outside the easyjet office. All the staff I dealt with were all pleasant , helpful and polite. There was a minor hiccup with our rooms when we got there - no sofa bed for our daughter in our room - but that was very quickly and calmly sorted out with no fuss. We had a executive room with a sofa in and they are a good size and very comfortable. The bed was also extremely comfortable, so beware of that velcro pyjama feeling if you have a flight to catch the next morning ! The breakfast buffet is excellent with a really good choice and the service was extremely good. We were then taken again by free shuttle to the station. A really positive experience and a good start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: mlloyd01
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel but seems to be run seamlessly, with one exception I found the staff extremely helpful and accomodating, the room was very comfortable and very clean, and the little bar was very relaxing, the bar-man was an excellent chap who couldn't do enough for you. Breakfast was excellent and the dining room was bright and cheerful. We would probably have had dinner, but when I went to have a look around upon our arrival, I was met by a young woman who was obviously in the wrong occupation, she was unhelpful and verged upon the contemptuous, needless to say we spent our Euros elsewhere. The hotel was excellent, and the restaurant would not put me off, Just don't have dinner.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel - well reccomend it!”
Reviews.Author: vacationqueen1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during march of 2008 and loved it. the room was reasonably sized and exceptionally clean. Bathroom was new and spotless with a good hairdryer. The hotel was very well soundproofed and we didnt hear a peep from outside or other guests There is a regular and punctual holiday inn bus that picks you up from the station and delivers you to the door of the hotel. It also takes you to the airport in the morning. It runs 24 hours a day and is free. There is a super spa with steam rooms and roof garden at this hotel too which we made full use of and this made our trip even more enjoyable! The bar and restaurant are fabulous and the staff friendly and helpful. While this hotel is situated outside of Berlin, it is within easy reach and absolutely perfect for the airport. Would definately visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the airport...”
Reviews.Author: jmcglynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short weekend break in Berlin and it's a great hotel. The hotel is pretty much in the middle of nowhere so I wouldn't recommend staying there if you wanted to be close to the city centre. It took us about 40mins on the metro to get into Berlin. For the airport it's great, there's a shuttle every 20mins or so that will take you between the two and also stops off at the metro station. It cost us £35 for a double room (without breakfast which cost about £8 - there are some places, but not many, at the metro station if you don't want to pay that. Also some places at the airport) which was really good value considering the hotel looked pretty new. My husband said the gym was good and you can even do curling if you fancy it!! The food in the restaurant is fairly expensive, even the bar food would cost you about £6 for a salad! We ate in the bar area in the evening and the food was nice. It's also a nice little area to sit and chill in, although a bit drafty!! The staff were great, even changing our feather pillows to hypoallergenic ones due to allergies. Remember you will be on the East Side of Berlin - we didn't realise this at first and got into all kinds of trouble with the metro and underground system!! The metro stations are not great, further out there's no information on when the next one will arrive and you need to look at the front of the train to see where it's going. Further into the city centre the stations get a bit more technologically advanced! All in all, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Carebear79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn during a standard touristy weekend. The inclusive shuttle but was regular from the airport [4 times in the hour] and no more than a 10 minute drive away. Staff speak good English and check-in was efficient [well this is Germany]. There is a nice bar and restaurant downstairs which I did not frequent. I had ordered room service which was a good standard and flexible with my vegeterianism. Room was clean and subtly furnished and had a nice view of a small park strip alongside the hotel. Bed was modern and good quality. TV had few English channels which isn't surprising. Bathroom was quite good. Overall good hotel would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the Schonefeld airport”
Reviews.Author: Svein
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for the second time, - it is very good if you arrive late at Schonefeld ( future berlin International). Don't bother with the free shuttle if it is not there when you arrive. You will have to wait for up to 30 min for it to arrive, catch a taxi, it is 6-7 minutes drive away and cost € 7. Very good hotel, very good breakfast, friendly. But is is far away from Berlin. Took the shuttle to the train station, from there the U-bahn used 45 minutes to the center og western berlin ( Zoo station).

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: stuart462
Reviews.Content: This hotel's nice. One of the better Holiday Inns in fact. The main thing is that it is quiet and peaceful, yet a quick ride to the airport. My room was lovely, overlooking a field and the breakfast room was lovely and sunny, although locating all the food took a few goes! Because it's quiet, there's not much nearby. You also need a shuttle (free) to the airport or railway / S-bahn, which is not so good if you stay out late in central Berlin as it's quite a distance.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Shortstop44
Reviews.Content: Driving through the Berlin area and not wanting the bother of trying to drive into the city centre, we decided to find an airport hotel and use their transport. Good strategy. Signage all around the airport made the Holiday Inn easy to find. Parking was free on-street. Shuttle service to the airport train station (5 minutes) made it easy to take the train downstairs. We had a very good evening meal in the hotel and the breakfast was much above average. My wife cut her foot stepping on a luggage strap and the desk supplied what was necessary from a first aid kit. 160 Euros a night for a family of three in one room was about average for Europe. Good experience all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “well worth staying at”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel with nice facilities such as a sauna & steam room. Rooms were well furnished and very clean. A nice touch is a free shuttle bus from the local airport plus a regular free shuttle bus service to the U Bahn Station nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter999
Reviews.Content: After feeling faint after looking at the prices of hotels in the centre of Birmingham I decided to book a couple of nights at the Holiday Inn Schonefeld Airport. There was an initial problem with the courtesy vehicle from the airport being full with a group, but after that everything went smoothly. I was impressed with the hotel which was comfortable and affordable - I slept well both nights I stayed. If you want some exercise it is only ten minutes walk from the Deutsche Bahn station with trains taking 30 minutes to the city centre. I would recommend the hotel if you are flying into Schonefled airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Between Flights!”
Reviews.Author: Vardomannen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after arriving on a late flight. I couldn't be bothered to head into central Berlin, so had booked this Holiday Inn in advance. I hold a Platinum Card for Holiday Inn Hotels so was immediately upgraded to the best business room they had (having paid the princely sum of 50 Euro - now that's value!). The receptionist was welcoming and promised that a bottle of wine (complimentary) would be sent up to the room. The wine never arrived, but a plate of fruit and cakes did. Still, it was 11pm and I really wasn't in the mood for wine anyway! The room was over-average size for Europe, with a king-size bed, sofa, writing desk and tea/coffee making facilities and minibar. The bathroom was spotless (believe me, I check...if there's one thing I hate it's signs of other peoples' bathroom use....). Holiday Inn provides a shuttle bus from Schönefeld Airport terminal as well as the S-Bahn station in Schönefeld (which is basically in the same area). I took a taxi from the airport to the hotel, because it had been a long day and I weas basically to lazy to wait/contact the hotel. It cost 12 Euro. The bus runs twice an hour if I remember correctly, so no long waits here. The S-Bahn will get you into central Berlin in about 45 minutes - you may have to change trains, depending on which area of the centre you want to go to. All in all, this was a great choice after a late arrival. It was clean, comfprtable and welcoming and aircraft noise was insignificant (I think the airport is closed at night). One slight minus; the public areas are very smoker. As an ex-smoker I tend to find this a bit of a turn off. But that's more to do with German laws and regulations than the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - handy to aiport”
Reviews.Author: MrsRaymondo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of October - on arrival in Berlin and again on our last night. The hotel is situated close to the airport and the airport train station. The hotel operates a 24 hour free minibus between the hotel, the airport and the train station (queue at the 'Holiday Inn' bus stops outside). The bus circles every 20 mins between 8.00am and 10.00pm. Outside these hours you need to ring the hotel (the number is on the bus stops). The hotel itself is excellent - very clean and the rooms are spacious. Our first room had an iron/board and bath with shower. Our second room had a shower only with no iron. Both our rooms had tea/coffee making facilities and mini bar. On both occasions chocolates were left on our pillows. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was not included in our rate but we paid separately for this (15.50 euro each). Although not cheap, the breakfast was excellent and set us up for the day (fruit, juices, yoghurts,cheeses, cereals, cold meats, various breads, toast, cooked bacon, eggs, mushrooms). Although quite a way out from the centre of Berlin, the hotel is excellent and a good choice if you have an early or late flight. But as the trains operate so regularly this is also a good and unexpensive base for sightseeing. Berlin transport offer a 'Welcome Card' for around 20 euro (depending on length of stay and area covered) which allows travel on trains/buses and underground for 2 or 3 days. If staying in the Holiday Inn Schoenefeld you will need the Welcome Card which covers zones A,B and C as the Holiday Inn is in zone C.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reliable if using Schoenefeld”
Reviews.Author: Espoo2006
Reviews.Content: This is your best choice if you are flying out of Berlin-Schoenefeld early in the morning. As the airport is far from the city center, and you have an early morning flight to catch, you can't do better than this Holiday Inn. There is a free hotel shuttle that would drop you off or pick you up at the Schoenefeld S-Bahn station, which is just a few minutes from the hotel. Rooms are standard Holiday Inn quality, and the overall the hotel provides you with a nice start or end to your holiday. Be mindful that breakfast costs extra, and if you are using public transportation count on at least 20-30 minutes before reaching the center of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “superb quality”
Reviews.Author: Alex_from_Catalonia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top quality at a very good price. The rooms are very clean and modern, the breakfast buffet is superb. I have to say the second time I stayed was more expensive than the first, so maybe little by little the prices are going up. The only drawback I found is that it is not located in Berlin itself. So it is good for catching your plane in the morning, as it is located at the airport itself, but not for going into the city and back to the hotel. Maybe this is the reason the price is good. By the way, these comments refer to my two stays in 2004, so I cannot say how it is now in 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Believe it or not, I loved it...”
Reviews.Author: Diplomatic_Spouse
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed only one night in January 2006 in between flights at Schonefeld, but frankly, it was super clean, the bed was very, very comfy and the coffee machine was decent. It's not a great location if you're going to be doing a lot of touring in the city, but for a one or two night stay, it'll help you get a good night's sleep. Don't bother with the overpriced food.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: imagine71
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Schoenefeld Airport is no more or less than a standard Holiday Inn hotel. The rooms are small and clean. They feature the standard ameneties of a Holiday Inn. The real problem was the service at check-out in the morning when the tiny reception desk was unable to handle all the guests wishing to check out. The public areas, restaurant and bar were standard 3 star quality. I found nothing impressive about the hotel. The location is OK if you are spending an overnight close to the airport but way out of reach of everything in Berlin. That was OK for me since I only stayed there because of a function at the hotel - but I would not recommend it to people visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to airport, not to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: zigmund
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night due to flight timings and found the overall experience to be a good one. One of the best things was that there was a bowl of fruit in my room upon arrival. I don't know if this was because I am a Priority Club member or they do it for everyone, but it made for a nice welcome at the end of a long day working in Berlin. The room was good value (€85/night including breakfast) The hotel has a shuttle which picks up at the airport (I think you have to phone) and also at the s-bahn station nearby. The distance is not walkable unless you really like walking a lot. The hotel is near the airport, but access is via a major road and a long link road. Breakfast in the morning was good with all the usual things like frys, breads, meats, cheeses, etc . . . no complaints there. It took a while to locate the restaurant though because it is through a passageway behind the bar and when I walked into the bar in the morning it was empty and there was no sign of any dining room. I had to check with reception who insisted that the restaurant was at the end of the building before I found it. As other posters have said it is not a place to stay if you want to see Berlin - stay downtown somewhere instead. Getting to downtown Berlin from the hotel would take at least 70-80 minutes depending on timing with the shuttle and train. I would stay there again, but only for flight timing reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Full Marks”
Reviews.Author: Hotelwatcher
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night as I had a flight the following morning. The hotel itself is very clean, the rooms of a very good standard. I had an excellent evening meal in the hotel restaurant, breakfast provided a good and varied selection. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Good shuttle service to and from the airport.All in all, very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ok I guess but only use it if you have to”
Reviews.Author: Ellis40
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've stopped in an airport hotel and maybe I should expect these things. First of all the good points, it is close to the hotel and it does get you there at any time and also will pick you up from the S bahn station. The rooms are what you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The service at the restautrant is slow and the meals are over priced. The beer prices at the bar are also expensive. When I arrived I was told I had booked a single room (I had booked a double) and then had to hand over €25 as deposit for the mini bar. In the morning I told them I hadn't used it and got the deposit back- what a waste of time, I could have said anything. We had an early flight so had to stop close to the airport. In future I would look for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: EGrimes
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this is a great hotel if you are arriving at or departing from Berlin Schoenefeld Airport. It was a great start to our holiday, which took us to Poland and Estonia, and a good finish too, i.e. one night in the Holiday Inn at the beginning and end of our trip. The staff were all very friendly, the rooms a delight, with everything you could want for an overnight stay: hairdryer; coffee maker; mini bar; TV; even tissues in the bathroom, which was very well planned. We liked this hotel a lot, particularly as we got a very good rate, 45 euros a night, though breakfast was an extra 15 euros each per day. The breakfast is excellent, and if the weather is good, you can sit out on the terrace. There is a children's play area with paddling room, and some easy chairs for mum and dad. There is a 'wellness' centre and also a roof garden. The (comp.) shuttle to and from the airport works well - the train station is about 500 m. from the airport terminal, and it costs 2 euro and takes about 45-60 mins. to get to the centre of the city. Thus, if you are out sightseeing all day, and just want to return to a hotel to relax and eat dinner/drink wine, this hotel would suit. But if you want to go out in the city in the evening, look elsewhere. We found it peaceful and relaxing and would not hesitate to use it again. All in all an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We wanted to stay here but...”
Reviews.Author: Axwell
Reviews.Content: The shuttlebus from the airport worked well and the lobby was very nice. Unfortunately that was as far as we got. Despite having had a reservation for 4 months, we were told that there had been a "computer error" (that seemed to be the story they finally settled on) and they were transferring us to another hotel (The Van der Valk Berliner-Ring - lovely hotel but....) which they assured us was just a few mintues away and also had a shuttlebus which ran to the airport (since our flight wasn't until late afternoon we were planning to spend the morning in central Berlin). In the event the other hotel was more than 20 minutes away and in the middle of nowhere with no public transport links and a shuttlebus could be hired for 15 euros each way to take you to the airport. This effectively scuppered our morning in Berlin. At least five other parties were the victims of the same thing the night we were there. What was infuriating was that the Holiday Inn had clearly known about the problem in advance yet made no effort to advise me of the difficulty before I arrived so that I could make the decision about where I stayed instead of them. So if you're booked in here I suggest you check before you arrive to make sure that you haven't been caught in the same trap.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Schoenefeld Airport Transfers”
Reviews.Author: Chris_NYorks
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night in November after arriving at the airport at night and flying out the next morning, booked on line a few days before, got a good rate. It took me a while to find out how to alert them that we were waiting for the transfer bus but the helpful young ladies in yellow caps at Schoenefeld airport pointed out their dedicated 'phone behind the information desk. They spoke English on the 'phone and said the bus was already on its way. It runs every 30 minutes from the Hotel so I'm not sure if they would make a special trip to get you if you had just missed one. As someone else has pointed out it is close to and fantastically convenient for the airport but not so good for Berlin City. We were going to do an early morning dash into Berlin before coming back for the flight but the Airport Express trains tend to run just before the hour and half-hour and their shuttle is on the hour and half hour. As the crow flies its a walkable distance to the station but there might be the railway line in the way, as it was dark I couldn't quite work out if this is possible and safe. The Hotel was very clean, modern and the staff spoke English. They had our on-line booking but offered us an upgrade that we declined; the economy room we had booked was just what we needed for the overnight stay. We had a drink in the bar but didn't use any other facilities or eat there. The transfer back to the airport was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are flying into Schoenefeld”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night in June 2004 because it is so close to the airport. It was very cheap($95 USD) and very nice. They have a complimentary shuttle to pick you up at the aiport and take you back, no matter how early (we left at 5 am to catch another flight). The food in the restaurant is actually very good as well. We had a great salmon and pasta dish. I probably wouldn't recommend staying here if you are planning on seeing Berlin (we didn't have time), because it seems a bit far out from the city itself. But, great for aiport travelers just passing thru!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Berlin Airport - Conference Centre
HotelInfo.Address: Hans-Grade-Allee 5, 12529 Berlin, Germany
